title: Product Management Jedi
descjob:
Location
Jakarta
Work Type
Permanent
Application Posted
March 29, 2022
About the Role:
Gojek is looking for entrepreneurial Product Managers to join a wide range of teams in the product organization. As a Product Manager you will run experiments as Experimentation enables us to move fast by rapidly validating ideas and implementations. You'll get to help solve consumer problems, define product visions, and build products to scale. You will work alongside other Product Managers, Engineering, BI Analysts, Data Science, Customer Research, UX designers to help Gojek deliver innovative and delightful product experiences.

What You Will Do
Drive ideation, product strategy and execution for your product division, partnering with your product development team and cross-functional stakeholders
Own a product stream end to end to frame product strategy and drive execution
Plan and participate in user research initiatives with the design and user research teams to understand customer problems and identify and iterate on product ideas and improvements
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in support, marketing, sales and business to develop product messaging, training and communications
Obsess over funnels, customer cohorts, trends and forecasts and amplify good ideas wherever in the organizations they come from
Define, track and report success metrics for a product, business, and customer
Reiterate on product plans, and make informed decisions using data and user feedback
Lead effective cadences and incorporate feedback into their product plan
Proactively be involved in the interview process and mentor new product managers
What You Will Need
A Bachelor’s / Masters or an equivalent degree, preferably in engineering or management
5+ years of experience in a progressive product company as a Product Manager
Analytical and data-driven, you love digging into the data to understand what’s happening and define & measure success on every project
You must have experience in working with product designers and have an eye for design
Ability to easily transition from high-level strategic thinking to detailed execution.
You’re entrepreneurial and are comfortable working in a complex and fast-paced environment
You’re fluent in English and are a confident communicator
Gojek is an excellent team because of the diverse backgrounds of our staff. In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. We sincerely encourage women, minorities, and people from underrepresented backgrounds to

title: Social and Influencer Marketing Manager, YouTube
descjob:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in creativity and data driven optimization (e.g., social and influencer marketing).
Experience in digital media planning and optimization.
Ability to speak and write in Indonesian and English fluently.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in statistical analysis, datasets, and social analytics.
Knowledge of YouTube’s ecosystem (e.g., user, creator, advertiser) with an understanding of short-form video trends.
Knowledge of Social Media and Influencer Marketing best practices and campaigns in Indonesia (i.e., owned, earned, and paid social media).
Knowledge of social media monitoring and listening tools (i.e., have built and maintained processes to manage user sentiment across social platforms).
Exceptional communication and analytical skills with the ability to work independently, form your own point of view, and recommendations.
A passion for content, entertainment, and cultural trends.
About the job
YouTube Marketing’s mission is to know our users, and to connect them to the magic of our products and creators. We make YouTube successful by shaping people’s perceptions of YouTube and inspiring them to engage with us. We’re also responsible for all of YouTube’s marketing activities to consumers, creators, and key opinion influencers.

As the Social and Influencer Marketing Manager, you will be shaping and driving the social presence of one of the most culturally significant brands of our times in a dynamic and growing region.

Working cross-functionally, you’ll lead social and influencer marketing for YouTube Marketing in Indonesia, across YouTube Shorts and YouTube overall. You will drive brand engagement, create earned conversations, elevate our social presence, and provide frequent and clear analysis to management allowing the organization to develop a strong understanding of what our users and creators care about.

You’ll manage the planning, execution and day-to-day operations of social and influencer marketing in Indonesia, plan and develop social and influencer campaigns, and work on proactive and reactive social listening and issue management. The role is cross-functional and international, you will work with global, local, and regional marketing and content teams. You will be a part of the YouTube Asia Pacific (APAC) Social Team and will report to the APAC Social Marketing Lead.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Partner with various marketing teams across regions to help develop programs that deliver intended business results.
Engage and lead social media agencies to build effective social media programs and campaigns for key YouTube products and campaigns targeted at users and creators, with clear strategy and breakthrough creativity.
Track and quantify social impact on YouTube business goals.
Work closely with Global, Regional, Social, Public Relation, and Policy teams as part of a Global Rapid Response team to put in place round-the-clock social listening/monitoring workflows and processes, proactive and reactive escalation, and management of user sentiment across social platforms.
Work closely with media teams on paid media amplification as well as with insights and measurement teams on social brand health and owned, earned, and paid reporting for campaigns and initiatives.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Marketing Manager, YouTube Shorts (English, Bahasa Indonesia...
descjob:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in marketing, including multi-stakeholder management across multiple markets.
Experience in campaign planning and execution.
Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa Indonesia fluently.
Preferred qualifications:

5 years of experience in product marketing, working in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry, consulting, on an internet-based product or service, and product marketing and/or brand development.
Experience building relationships and collaborating with global, regional, and local cross-functional teams (e.g., Brand, Social and Influencer, Insights, Partnerships, etc.).
Experience in marketing targeting younger audiences and working with agencies.
Knowledge of the YouTube ecosystem, short-form-video, digital trends, culture, and the creator community.
Ability to manage Go-To-Market planning, product research, insight generation, and value proposition development.
Ability to work on several projects and campaigns at once.
About the job
YouTube Marketing’s mission is to know our users, and to connect them to the magic of our products and creators. We make YouTube successful by shaping people’s perceptions of YouTube and inspiring them to engage with us. We’re also responsible for all of YouTube’s marketing activities to consumers, creators, and key opinion influencers.

As a Marketing Manager in the Indonesia YouTube Marketing Team, you will work on growing YouTube in the region. As a result, more users will consider YouTube as a platform for entertainment, learning, growing their audience, and expressing their creativity.
You will work with global, regional, and local teams to build YouTube Shorts Go-To-Market plans, manage above the line and below the line campaigns and activations, and balance local relevance with global cohesion. Tracking the performance of our campaigns will inform what's working, how we can keep improving our marketing execution, product growth, and health of our ecosystem.
In this role, you are passionate about YouTube, the short-form-video space, and understand creators and their needs. You will use your project management and campaign experience to work seamlessly with global, regional, local, Marketing teams, and key cross-functional stakeholders. You may also manage relationships and output from external agencies and partners.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Provide YouTube Shorts Go-To-Market plans in Indonesia to ensure campaign work is aligned to the YouTube Shorts mission and strategy.
Plan, create, innovate, and transform hard-to-communicate points into actionable activation plans and/or campaigns.
Plan, execute activations, and campaigns to grow YouTube Shorts viewers and creators, and identify opportunities to localize and scale when/where relevant.
Measure and optimize campaigns to ensure efficiency and positive return on investment through pilot, test, and learn. Capture, share learnings, and best practices across global, regional, local marketing, and cross-functional teams.
Establish close working relationships with both internal stakeholders and external agencies.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Marketing - Seller Communications
descjob:
DepartmentMarketing
LevelExperienced (Team Lead)
LocationIndonesia - Jakarta
The Marketing team at Shopee is responsible for conceptualising and implementing go-to-market activities to achieve increased usage and visibility. The team covers areas including Campaigns Management, Community, Public Relations, Partnerships, Offline Marketing and Design. The Regional Marketing team is responsible for strategising and implementing go-to-market activities and working with local teams to localise marketing for the specific markets. The Brand and Growth Marketing team covers all aspects of online and performance marketing for the region. This team is responsible for data-driven solutions, tracking and measuring data to reach the targeted customers. Browse our Marketing team openings to see how you can make an impact with us.
Job Description:
Manage and lead a function under the Communications team, and take ownership of team development and performance
Plan and implement seller communications requests’ strategy with stakeholders
Execute and initiate projects to support performance optimization and operational excellence improvements within the team
Evaluate and conduct regular analysis and reporting of communication channels’ (email, notifications, SMS, etc.) performance, develop and execute recommendations for improvement
Perform daily approvals for seller communications materials, ensuring a smooth process flow
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree from a recognised university
4+ years of experience in Communications, Marketing or related fields
Demonstrated ability in leading and managing a team (minimum 1 year experience)
Demonstrated ability in handling various communication channels with a deep understanding of end-to-end communications process (from catering incoming requests to executing it)
Excellent copywriting and content writing skills, with the ability to understand different language styles that appeal to various target markets
Excellent organizational abilities and prioritization of initiatives; strong project management skills, and has the ability to breakdown big picture ideas into smaller actionable items
Possesses a high attention to detail, able to make decisions quickly and effectively, and strong negotiation skills
Outstanding analytical skills and comfortable with analyzing complex, large scale data sets
Result-driven attitude and eagerness to adapt with the dynamic environment of e-commerce
Excellent presentation and communication skills, written and verbal in both Bahasa Indonesia and English

title: Social Media Creative Lead
descjob:
About the Role
As the Creative group head for Gojek social media, you’ll take the wheel in creative ideation campaigns for Gojek’s vast array of products. Reporting to the VP and CD of the Creative stream, you’ll lead the discussion and development of creative ideations amongst various internal stakeholders, and oversee the production process from end-to-end - from its inception, design, development, to execution. You’ll get a front-row seat (and get your hands dirty) in running impactful marketing campaigns through marrying business objectives and current trends, driving our beloved products to more corners of the world.
What You Will Do
Lead brainstorming sessions with the team to come up with exceptional ideas
Devise your own creative ideas & execution that answer the briefs from the Marketing team
Develop 360 social media campaigns for the brand, manage details about the product and required communication strategy, and create ideas that can be used across various platforms to support campaigns
Gain an understanding of the target audience and business related to campaign needs
Establish criteria and oversee production and testing of idea prototypes
Remain up to date with current trends in the creative marketing field
What You Will Need
At least 5 years of relevant experience in a creative role at an advertising or digital marketing
Expert in thinking out of the box and having a good understanding of user and audience’s needs and expectations
Have a deep understanding of how social media campaign works across all platform (IG, Twitter, FB, TikTok)
Advanced knowledge and prior experience implementing creative advertising visuals, headlines, content copy, and award-winning/industry benchmark ideas and executions that meet our target audiences’ tastes
Ability to spot trends, assess new data, and keep abreast with the latest marketing techniques
About the Team
What are Creative Labs? A bunch of creative geeks? A cult of mad scientists? The truth is… we’re a combination of both! As part of the Gojek Marketing Team, we’re made up of Project Managers, Accountants, Strategists, Copywriters, Graphic Designers, Art directors, and Social Media Creatives who work together to turn business objectives into creative outputs.

Based in Jakarta, Indonesia, our main focus is to create the right communication - copy, visuals, medium included - to heighten user acquisition. We want to convey to as many people as possible the value of Gojek’s products in solving everyday problems - from food, transport, to payments - and easing our daily routines. We prioritize in-depth understanding of our target audience, and craft all of our creative campaigns based on these findings. Some of these past campaigns include Foodiskon, Ramadan, “It’s OK To Be Lebay”, and J3K.

Currently, our team has been working on a lot of innovation and promotional campaigns, which will help Gojek maintain our leadership in the market. Unsurprisingly, our creative family comprises music enthusiasts, coffee connoisseurs, and movie buffs. Regardless of whether we’re working from home or the office, one of our favorite aspects of being a part of the Creative Labs fam is that we get to dress however we want! After all, fashion is a creative mode of expression If this sounds like a team you’d like to be a part of, we’ll save you a spot at the table.
About Us
Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'
Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.
As of 2021, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.
Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.
Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.
